text: Hi, I'm Antonio.
Welcome to 'This is My Model'.
Today I'm joined by Pep from Aizon.

Welcome Pep.
Thank you for having me.
Thank you for being here.
Tell us a little bit about Aizon.

At Aizon, we built a SaaS platform 
to enable the biotech and pharma industry
to use AI and ML in compliance,

which is relevant given the scrutiny 
that regulatory organizations
like the FDA put on our customers.
I guess having data sets that you can exploit with ML

in the pharmaceutical industry is complex, right? 
It is.

And we do a lot of magic in the terabytes 
and terabytes of data we collect
and bring to S3.
Algorithm for detecting raw data or anomalies

that we don't want there 
and bring to our customers clean data sets they can use.
Absolutely.

So your company provides 
to your customers some platforms

that goes through the full 
cycle of data ingestion, transformation,
compliance, exploitation with ML, and visualization.
Today we have here a snapshot of the ML part of it.
Can you walk us through it?
Absolutely.
So we built a low-code/no-code platform
to allow our customers to use this data.

Queried it by Athena 
and get the data sets they want to analyze
and bring those data sets to SageMaker

where using our pharma algorithms, 
they can start training models.
Why exactly are you using SageMaker?
What is the value that it provides to you?
It's very important.
We are not tech people doing pharma.
We are pharma people doing tech,

and we need to focus 
on what's relevant for the pharma industry,

using tools like SageMaker 
really cut a big overhead

and we can concentrate 
on what brings value to our customers.
That's nice.

So your customers go to your platform, 
which is low-code/no-code,

and then they can basically use the data 
and have a set of algorithms

that you provide from training the models, 
right, with SageMaker.
And then they will serve the models using Fargate,
in this case when doing the predictions, is that right?
That's correct.

So, can you tell us an example 
of a use case of one of those models
that your customers are doing there?
Sure.

One of the processes that is in every single biotech 
in the world are fermentations.

We provide a set of algorithms 
specialized in helping our customers
get optimal yields in their fermentation processes,
taking into account raw material, the weather,
which machinery I'm using.

So being sure that those predictions 
bring my fermentation
to an optimal yield.
Absolutely, that's a super interesting use case.
I'm sure you have many more of those.

But Pep, how do you see AI being used 
in the pharmaceutical industry?
Pharma industry is not using that much AI,
at least on the manufacturing side,

given the compliance 
and the complexity that's there.

Bringing compliant AI with qualified algorithms 
and validated models
that they can consume easily using the API gateway
facilitates the use of these machine learning models
in manufacturing better drugs.
And that's a real impact.
Thank you for sharing that, Pep.
It's been a pleasure.
And thank you for watching 'This is My Model'.
